data.footnote: Stu on flute
data.shownotes:
I'm In Your Mind Fuzz was played for the first time known since 2016-08-19. (106 show gap) Crumbling Castle was played for the first time known since 2016-09-08. (88 show gap) Robot Stop contained a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Crumbling Castle was confirmed by video. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net

The Lord of Lightning contained a Cellophane tease. Robot Stop contained a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. Let There Be Rock was played as a tribute to Malcolm Young, who had passed the day before. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Let There Be Rock was confirmed by video. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net

Headline set at Gizzfest Sydney 2017. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

data.shownotes: “On The Road Again” (Rockets) played as the band came on stage. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro.

Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. Cut Throat Boogie was played for the first time known since 2016-05-13. (148 show gap) Danger $$$ was played for the first time known since 2016-05-14. (146 show gap) KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. data.footnote: Stu on flute
data.shownotes: This show featured the debuts of Greenhouse Heat Death, D-Day, The Book, Polygondwanaland, and The Fourth Colour. The vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion was not performed. All Is Known was played for the first time since 2018-02-18. (69 show gap) Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. Evil Death Roll was played for the first time since 2017-06-06. (50 show gap) Big Fig Wasp was played for the first time since 2016-09-22. (100 show gap)

data.footnote: Stu on flute
data.shownotes: The Coffee Cola Song (Francis Bebey) played as the band came on stage. At the start of the show, Joey says this is "the biggest show we've ever played". Before Nuclear Fusion, Joey said that he had said he wasn't going to do the vocal intro anymore, but that he'd "do it tonight". He jokingly apologized to Sam after the vocal intro. The Book was instrumental. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. Sister Ray (The Velvet Underground) was played over the PA as the setbreak music with a 15 minute countdown on the screen. Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg contained alternate lyrics and Stu on flute. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease.

Poster by Olya Dyer limited to 100 prints KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Big Fig Wasp was confirmed through video recording. The rest of the songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This was the band's first show in Ireland, and took place at the historic Olympia Theatre (later known as 3Olympia Theatre for sponsorship purposes). The band was supported by Mild High Club. Alex Brettin from Mild High Club sat in during King Gizzard's set for D-Day and The Book. God Is In The Rhythm was played for the first time known since 2015-06-24. (241 show gap)

This show featured the debut of Beginner's Luck. Stu sat in on flute with opener Mild High Club on Sketches of Brunswick East II. Alex Brettin from Mild High Club played guitar for D-Day and The Book. Malcolm Brown (formerly of Whitney) played keyboard on Beginner's Luck.

data.footnote: Stu on flute
data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Rock N’ Roll. On The Road Again (Rockets) played as the band came on stage. The vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion was not performed. Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg contained alternate lyrics and Stu on flute. Before Rock N’ Roll, Joey had to gently kick a fan off the stage. Stu later mentioned that they were recording the show that night, and that the unreleased song (Rock N’ Roll) was "kinda new". A pro-shot video of The Fourth Colour was released on the Flightless Records YouTube channel. The Fourth Colour contained a tuning session outro with a droning noise playing in the background, and eventually Cellophane teases. Robot Stop contained Master of the Universe (Hawkwind) teases and quotes, and a Hot Water tease. Malcolm Brown (formerly of Whitney) played keyboard on Beginner's Luck. Stu sat in on flute with opener Mild High Club on Sketches of Brunswick East II.
King Khan performed improvised vocals over God Is In The Rhythm

data.footnote: Stu on flute
data.shownotes: “Electricity” (Captain Beefheart) played from the PA as the band came on stage. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg featured Stu on flute and alternate lyrics same as the KEXP performance. During the jam before Robot Stop, which contained The River, Am I In Heaven?, and Head On/Pill teases and quotes, Stu shouted out visual artist Jason Galea and wished him a happy birthday. Robot Stop contained a “Master Of The Universe” (Hawkwind) jam with lyrics. Poster by Carlo Vivary

data.footnote: Stu on flute

data.shownotes: Vomit Coffin was played for the first time since 2017-04-12. (82 show gap) Altered Beast I was played for the first time since 2017-04-18. (78 show gap)

Riff Raff (AC/DC) played as the band came on stage. Before Digital Black, Joey said "this is our biggest show in America, ever", and Stu thanked Amyl & The Sniffers (the opening act). Vomit Coffin was incomplete. Alter Me I was incomplete. Before Rattlesnake, Stu shouted out John Bonham as a "s--t bloke, good drummer", followed by a short Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) tease. The vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion was not performed. Before The Wheel Joey shouted out Sammy on the sound, Jason Galea who was working the projectors, Gaspard who was working the monitors, and "Nate Dog on the merch". Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases, and the intro contained a Trapdoor tease. Joey thanked Amyl & The Sniffers again after Gamma Knife.

“Whiplash” (Metallica) played as the band came on stage. Vomit Coffin and Alter Me I were incomplete. Before Rattlesnake, Stu shouted out Amyl & The Sniffers, the opening act. Greenhouse Heat Death contained a Sleep Drifter tease. Sleep Drifter contained a Rattlesnake tease. Billabong Valley contained a Sleep Drifter tease. After The Wheel, Joey said "That song was our Jerry Garcia attempt". The intro to Robot Stop contained Trapdoor, Cellophane, and Hot Water teases, and the song itself contained a Hot Water tease. At the end of the show, Joey shouted out the Golden State Warriors, the local NBA team, who were in the midst of the 2018 NBA finals series.
This was an in-studio appearance for radio station KEXP in Seattle. Following the performance Stu had a 12 minute interview with KEXP DJ Cheryl Waters.

Head On/Pill was played for the first time since 2017-06-24. (68 show gap). The intro to Robot Stop contained Trapdoor and Hot Water teases. Head On/Pill contained Sea of Trees teases and quotes, Hot Water teases, Alter Me I teases and quotes, Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes, a Robot Stop tease, and Cellophane teases and quotes.

The intro to Robot Stop contained Cellophane and Head On/Pill teases. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Robot Stop through Big Fig Wasp, Rattlesnake, All Is Known through Digital Black and The Lord of Lightning through Crumbling Castle have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed by contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
Poster by Sébastien Lépine
Altered Beast II was played for the first time since 2017-10-14. (53 show gap)

Vomit Coffin was incomplete, and only one verse of Alter Me I was sung. Robot Stop contained Head On/Pill and Hot Water teases. Head On/Pill contained Alter Me quotes, Cellophane, Sea of Trees, and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes, and Hot Water and Robot Stop teases
I'm In Your Mind was played for the first time since 2017-01-21. (133 shows) Alter Me II was played for the first time since 2017-12-02. (50 show gap)

Before Digital Black, Stu asked the crowd if anyone was at the band's previous show in Atlanta, followed by Cavs briefly teasing Moby Dick. Hot Wax, which was played for the first time known since 2016-05-14 (199 show gap), was performed at the request of a fan who asked the band after their previous show if they could play it. Billabong Valley was dedicated to "all them abandoned kitties next door". Sleep Drifter contained a Honey intro tease. After All Is Known, Joey shouted out an audience member's 21st birthday and brought them on stage. Only Part I of The River was played, and it contained a brief blues intro. Wah Wah was played for the first time since 2016-12-09 (138 show gap) and contained The River quotes and teases. Robot Stop contained a “Master Of The Universe” (Hawkwind) jam with lyrics and Hot Water teases.
Mystery Jack was played for the first time known since 2013-08-29. (415 show gap)
Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were played for the first time since 2017-12-02. (57 show gap)

Sleep Drifter contained Doom City and Rattlesnake teases. Muddy Water contained a Cellophane tease. The intro to Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease. After The River, Joey shouted out Desiigner who performed following the band's set
The Balrog was played for the first time since 2017-03-24. (133 show gap) I'm In Your Mind Fuzz was played for the first time since 2017-11-23. (66 show gap)

This show was broadcast live by NPO 3 Extra. “Stayin' In Black” (Bee Gees + AC/DC by Wax Audio) played through the PA as the band came on stage. Following Altered Beast II, Joey joked that he preferred Lowlands over Pukkelpop (another European festival the band played the day before). Sleep Drifter contained Billabong Valley and Rattlesnake teases. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease and a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics.
Am I In Heaven? was played for the first time since 2017-10-07. (81 show gap)
I'm Not In Your Mind was played for the first time since 2017-01-21. (151 show gap)

This show opened with a 13 minute jam before the band's set that evolved out of the band tuning. Vomit Coffin was incomplete. Sleep Drifter contained Billabong Valley and Rattlesnake teases. Only Part I of The River was performed. Robot Stop contained Cellophane, Rattlesnake, Master of The Universe, and Hot Water teases. Am I In Heaven? contained Alter Me, Cellophane, Rattlesnake, and Pill teases and quotes, as well as Robot Stop teases.
Elbow was played for the first time known since 2013-08-28. (437 show gap) Danger $$$ was played for the first time since 2017-12-07. (71 show gap)
Road Train was played for the first time known since 2016-12-09. (161 show gap)
Sleep Drifter contained an intro jam and a Billabong Valley Tease.

This show featured the debut of The Great Chain of Being and The Bitter Boogie. Stressin' was played for the first time known since 2016-03-04. (244 show gap). Only Part I of The River was performed. Wah Wah contained The River teases and quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Stressin' through Elbow and The River through The Bitter Boogie were confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed based on a photo of the written setlist, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show featured the debut of Tezeta. Let Me Mend The Past was played for the first time known since 2013-11-13. (433 show gap) Dead-Beat was played for the first time known since 2015-06-26 (311 show gap). Muckraker was played for the first time known since 2015-07-09. (299 show gap)

This show featured the debut of Work This Time. Pop In My Step was played for the first time since 2013-11-29 (444 show gap).

Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The Great Chain of Being, Pop In My Step, and Work This Time have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show featured the debut of Year Of Our Lord. Riff Raff (AC/DC) played as the band came on stage. Cut Throat Boogie was played for the first time since 2017-12-07. (80 show gap) Let Me Mend the Past was introduced as "another old one, from the heart of [Ambrose's] 20 year old self". Eyes Like The Sky was played for the first time known since 2016-02-17. (257 show gap) The Raid was played for the first time known since 2013-11-13. (436 show gap) Only Part I of The River was performed. Wah Wah contained The River teases. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease. Head On/Pill contained Hot Water and Robot Stop teases as well as Alter Me, Am I In Heaven?, and Cellophane teases and quotes. After Head On/Pill, Joey thanked all the bands that played at Gizzfest 2018.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, The Bitter Boogie was confirmed via audio/video recording and the remaining songs were confirmed based on a photo of the written setlist, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Planet B and portions of Self-Immolate and Organ Farmer were released on the PHC FILMS YouTube channel. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Self-Immolate, Planet B, Gamma Knife through Billabong Valley, Cyboogie through Murder Of The Universe and Organ Farmer have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Hot Water featured Adam Halliwell on flute. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Self-Immolate was confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100
Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage.

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Work This Time contained a guitar solo for the first time. The Bitter Boogie contained Cyboogie teases and Boogieman Sam quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Planet B through The Fourth Colour, Work This Time, Let Me Mend The Past and Self-Immolate through The Bitter Boogie were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. After Doom City, the Han-Tyumi voice said "Thank you Seattle" and a quote from Murder of the Universe multiple times. Wah Wah contained a River intro during which Joey thanked openers ORB and Stonefield, as well as containing The River quotes. 

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Robot Stop contained an Alter Me tease. The Bitter Boogie contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes and Cyboogie teases.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 160

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Open Water featured a drum solo. Joey dedicated Work This Time, which contained a guitar solo, to Dan Bilzerian, with him claiming he saw "about 500 Dan Bilzerians" before the show. After Doom City, Ambrose thanked openers ORB and Stonefield. Before Cyboogie, the Han-Tyumi voice was used to say "Hello" repeatedly. Gamma Knife contained Robot Stop teases and quotes. Am I In Heaven? contained Boogieman Sam, Cyboogie and Alter Me quotes and teases and Rattlesnake, Hot Water and Head On/Pill teases. 

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Sleep Drifter contained a Honey intro tease. The River contained Wah Wah quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. All songs except Venusian 1 and Anoxia were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

This show featured the debut of Sense. Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band came on stage. Only Part I of The River was performed. Wah Wah contained The River quotes and teases. Work This Time contained a false start due to the band starting at the wrong tempo and featured a guitar solo.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the base came on stage. Robot stop contained Hot Water teases. There was a brief stop following Cyboogie due to an error in the PA system.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band came on stage. Sense featured use of a Vocoder during part of the vocals. Before Head On/Pill, the Han-Tyumi voice was used to say "Hello" repeatedly, as well as "Thank you", as the band thanked the crowd and opening acts ORB and Stonefield. Head On/Pill contained Am I In Heaven?, People-Vultures, Alter Me, and Boogieman Sam teases and quotes, and Cyboogie, Robot Stop, I'm In Your Mind, Rattlesnake, and Hot Water teases.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs was played for the first time known since 2015-12-09. (313 show gap) KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Self-Immolate through The Great Chain of Being, Boogieman Sam and Wah Wah through Float Along - Fill Your Lungs were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in London ‘19. Cellophane contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Before Float Along- Fill Your Lungs, Joey thanked openers Stonefield and ORB. All of ‘Planet B’ along with portions of ‘Self-Immolate’ and ‘Rattlesnake’ from this show are featured in the ‘Chunky Shrapnel’ album. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 500

Work This Time contained a guitar solo. The intro to Robot Stop contained Hot Water and Rattlesnake teases. Alter Me and Altered Beast I were on the setlist after Muddy Water but cut for time. The Wheel through Float Along – Fill Your Lungs was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live in Brussels ‘19. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 400

Doom City was on the written setlist after Billabong Valley but was not played. Wah Wah contained a River intro and The River teases and quotes. Head On/Pill contained a flute solo from Stu, Rattlesnake teases and Alter Me and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes. Stu’s flute solo from the ‘Head On/Pill’ jam is featured in the ‘Chunky Shrapnel’ album. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Venusian 2, Hot Water, Wah Wah, Road Train, Boogieman Sam and Head On/Pill have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band came on stage. After Billabong Valley a kid was invited on stage to hug the band. Am I In Heaven? contained teases and quotes of Pill, Boogieman Sam, and Alter Me. Organ Farmer was on the setlist before Am I in Heaven? but wasn't played. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Paris ‘19. Poster by Jason Galea Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before the show. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Robot Stop teases. Beginner's Luck featured Stu on flute. Following Beginner's Luck, the band played a short parody country song. Rattlesnake contained a Honey intro tease. Beginner’s Luck was released as a bonus feature for the 'Chunky Shrapnel' concert film.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Head On/Pill contained Rattlesnake quotes, Robot Stop, Venusuan 2 and The River teases and Hot Water, Am I In Heaven, Alter Me, and Cellophane teases and quotes, as well as guest performances from Stonefield and ORB members. Parts of the ‘Head On/Pill’ jam are featured in the ‘Chunky Shrapnel’ album. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Most of Head On/Pill was confirmed by audio/video recording. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Only Part I and II of The River were performed. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Most of the songs were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Cellophane contained Am I In Heaven? teases and Alter Me teases and quotes. The Bitter Boogie contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. All songs except Plastic Boogie, Organ Farmer, Digital Black and Vomit Coffin were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Cut Throat Boogie contained a Cruel Millennial outro. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

I'm Not In Your Mind contained Am I In Heaven? teases. Only Part I of The River was performed. Wah Wah contained The River teases and quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Venusian 2, I'm In Your Mind, I'm Not In Your Mind and The River through Planet B were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. All songs were confirmed by audio/video recordings except for This Thing which was confirmed via the written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. Additionally, KGLW.net staff were able to confirm that Parts I and II of The River were played, however we are unable to confirm whether this was a complete performance of the song or not. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This was the first 3 hour marathon-like concert, performed for fundraising and awareness of recent Australian bushfires, and the last concert performed with drummer Eric Moore. Evil Star intro song played from house speakers before the show. I'm Not in Your Mind contained a Cellophane tease. Cellophane contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Wah Wah contained The River teases and quotes. Willoughby's Beach was played for the first time known since 2016-06-25. (280 shows) Sea of Trees was played for the first time since 2017-04-02 (214 shows) and contained Head On/Pill teases. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. Superbug was dedicated to the Coronavirus.

data.jamchart_notes:
Does “biggest show gap in years” count?

Crumbling Castle had been played literally every couple shows for years. Then the band took a little break from playing it; this is its triumphant return (after Covid paused live music), as the encore for a tiny punk venue in northern California.  (2nd Biggest gap for CC, after 2017-11-18)
data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Persistence.  Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.  Honey contained Sleep Drifter teases.  Cavs and Cookie performed the Nuclear Fusion intro together as a "duet."

3 hour marathon set. Before the show, "Timeland" was played on the speakers. The intro to Nuclear Fusion was done by the band's sound tech Gaspard. Mr. Beat contained a Persistence tease. Billabong Valley contained a Sleep Drifter tease. During the setbreak, "Smoke & Mirrors" was also played via the venue's speakers. I'm Not In Your Mind contained a Dripping Tap tease. Gaia featured a drum solo. Cellophane featured Stu on flute. The River was dedicated to "Ambrose's ass" and the second segment was played faster per Stu's request. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Before The Dripping Tap, Stu shouted out the band's crew. The Dripping Tap contained Iron Lung quotes. Mystery Jack was on the setlist after The River, but not played due to time constraints. 

Poster By Jake Foreman

This show featured the debut of both Presumptuous and The Grim Reaper. Her and I contained an Am I In Heaven? intro, Presumptuous quotes, and an Iron Lung jam with lyrics. Presumptuous was introduced as being "like what Santana sounds like in 2022." Sea of Trees contained alternate lyrics ("ignore it" instead of "unfold") and The Dripping Tap and Head On/Pill teases. Hot Water contained Shanghai teases. The Grim Reaper was introduced as a song about a time Ambrose's neighbor believed that devils were chasing her.

This show featured the debut of Tetrachromacy. Following Self-Immolate, someone was kicked out of the venue. Persistence contained Head On/Pill teases and quotes. Muddy Water contained Perihelion teases and quotes and featured Ambrose on sax. Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap, Persistence, Alter Me, and Blame It On The Weather teases and quotes, as well as Shanghai and Change teases.

Poster By Michael Jager.

Final fifth of five nights in Barcelona for Primavera Sound. Preformed on the Tous Stage. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. teases. The Murder of the Universe suite was performed with “Juan-Tyumi” (Han-Tyumi speaking in Spanish). KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Planet B, Shanghai, and Rattlesnake have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The Dripping Tap contained a Cellophane tease. During The Dripping Tap, Stu crowd-surfed into the lake adjacent to the stage after saying "I think it's a nice day for a swim". Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Crumbling Castle and The Dripping Tap have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show was the final show of the US leg of the band's 2022 spring/summer world tour. The River was dedicated to Michael Bay and contained Wah Wah teases. After The River, the band shouted out their crew. Sadie Sorceress featured a guitar solo and contained quotes from The Grim Reaper.

Rattlesnake contained Automation and O.N.E. teases. Am I In Heaven? contained Magenta Mountain and Head On/Pill teases, Alter Me and Crumbling Castle teases and quotes, and both a Dripping Tap and Hypertension jam with lyrics. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Hot Water, Magenta Mountain, and most of Am I In Heaven? have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist for the night and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete or incorrect. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

This show featured the debut of Ice V. Wah Wah began with the intro to The River, and subsequently contained Crumbling Castle and The River teases. Ambrose quoted It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) before Doom City. O.N.E. began with the intro to Straws in the Wind instead of the customary intro. Pleura contained a quote of “Freedom” (Rage Against the Machine). Straws in the Wind was dedicated to Russell Brand. Smoke and Mirrors was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. Ambergris contained an Ice V tease. Before The Reticent Raconteur, Leah Senior was introduced to the stage as “The Original Balrog” and Joey gave a shoutout to her live bass player Jack [Robbins], with the bonus trivia that he was also in Stu’s first band Almacknjack. The Reticent Raconteur was played for the first time since 2021-02-24 (61 show gap). The Reticent Raconteur and The Lord of Lightning featured narration by Leah Senior. The Fourth Colour was played for the first time since 2019-11-23 (70 show gap). Am I in Heaven? contained The Dripping Tap teases. Poster by Jason Galea 800 standard / 50 Foil Print

This show featured the debut of Red Smoke.  Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Leah Senior was shouted out after Hot Water.  Hot Water was reprised during Robot Stop. Work This Time featured a guitar solo.

Poster By Carlo Vivary

Her and I contained Hell's Itch teases.  After The Fourth Colour, Joey asks the crowd to “take a step back”. The Grim Reaper contained Sadie Sorceress quotes. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were played for the first time since 2019-10-08 (96 show gap). Evil Death Roll contained Alter Me teases, Hell's Itch teases and a Hypertension Jam, which would debut properly the following night.

Poster By Arash Zarifian
Standard 250 / 30 Foil Prints

Evil Death Roll did not include the Invisible Face section and instead featured a Hypertension-esque jam (see below). The intro to Ambergris featured musical banter regarding a “big-ass beer”. Leah Senior was shouted out prior to Crumbling Castle. KGLW.net Staff Notes: There was a good deal of discussion about whether the jam in Evil Death Roll constituted a Hypertension tease or was merely suggesting a variation on Hypertension through Stu’s playing. We decided that this example did not qualify as a “tease”, “quote”, or full “jam.” Rather than expand our lexicon to include “motif” or “theme,” we opted to simply mention and qualify it in the setlist notes. Poster By Jordan Speer

Rattlesnake contained Sleep Drifter teases. The outro to Sleep Drifter contained Honey quotes before returning to the earlier Rattlesnake jam. Before Pleura, the band shouted out The Murlocs (with Cavs filling in on drums) for killing it prior to their set. Before Gaia, it was noted that Fishing for Fishies had been recorded by Gareth Liddiard of Tropical Fuck Storm. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Before The Dripping Tap, Joey again shouted out The Murlocs, Leah Senior, and “Tropical Fuck Cunts”. KGLW.net Staff Notes: For those wondering about the nature of the show-opening Rattlesnake sequence, the band is jamming on Rattlesnake themes before an immediate and natural transition to Honey, which is immediately followed by a segue into Sleep Drifter that contains elements of Honey all the way through, and finally a return to the bridge and “Rattle, rattle, rattle” portion of the preceding Rattlesnake jam, thus completing the “Snake Sandwich”.

Vomit Coffin featured the now-infamous “Amby Snot Rocket”. Blame It on the Weather was humorously announced as the “complete opposite style of music” to the show-opening Murder of the Universe suite. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Cut Throat Boogie was announced as a song about Ambrose getting stabbed in the neck with a broken bottle. Wah Wah began with the intro to The River and subsequently featured The River quotes and teases, as well as a jam. Sadie Sorceress featured an additional verse from The Grim Reaper played over the music to Sadie Sorceress. Joey requested the cameraperson zoom in to his face as close as possible during the intro to Self-Immolate and introduced Cavs as “John Henry Bonham”, followed by a drum solo and a “Moby Dick” (Led Zeppelin) tease, plus an additional brief drum solo and “Moby Dick” tease at the end of the song. Before Her and I (Slow Jam 2), the weather was discussed and the band’s ignorance regarding Fahrenheit to Celsius conversions was revealed. The song itself featured a Flamethrower jam, Slow Jam 1 and Magma teases, and a brief Cut Throat Boogie jam. Hot Wax was dedicated to one of the band's sound engineers, Joe Santarpia. Timeland was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Head On/Pill opened with “The Star-Spangled Banner” intro, contained Hypertension teases and a Witchcraft tease, and was unfinished leading into Am I in Heaven?. Venusian 1 closed with a Cavs drum solo which led into Venusian 2. Ambrose introduced Billabong Valley as being about a bushranger and is interrupted by Joey calling him “mad-cunt Morgan”. Let Me Mend The Past, which contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote, was announced as a song about Ambrose’s somewhat troubled upbringing and was dedicated to Edith, Ambrose’s sister. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Tetrachromacy and Hypertension were on the printed setlist but cut due to time constraints. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea Second Edition of Poster

The band introduced the show by acknowledging how little they play hometown shows, citing Melbourne inner-city gentrification. Crumbling Castle was then introduced as “The Fourth Colour”, “Crumbling Castle”, and finally, “Gamma Knife”. The Fourth Colour featured a Cavs drum solo. The Grim Reaper was introduced as a song that Ambrose wrote about Stu, and featured an additional verse and quotes from Sadie Sorceress. Stu sang the third verse twice instead of the second verse in Ice V. Iron Lung was introduced as a “song about vaping”. Ambergris was introduced as a song about “the most expensive naturally occurring ingredient”. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam.

This show was part of the 2022 Rhythm & Alps Festival. “The End” (The Doors) was briefly quoted after The Fourth Colour. Am I In Heaven? contained Witchcraft, Head On/Pill and The Dripping Tap teases. Amusing banter followed Am I in Heaven? where the band talked about their New Year’s resolutions. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo, during which Stu and Joey sprayed the crowd with champagne, followed by a full band “Moby Dick” (Led Zeppelin) tease. Boogieman Sam contained “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes. Some other artists appearing at this festival were specifically shouted out by Joey: Marlon Williams, Sampa the Great, and Dope Lemon.

Sleep Drifter contained Rattlesnake and O.N.E. teases. The Book was introduced as a song about Satan and featured a Cavs drum solo. Evil Death Roll contained a Robot Stop tease. Lava contained Hypertension and Superposition teases. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V teases, Iron Lung quotes and Witchcraft teases. Self-Immolate featured another Cavs drum solo. Gila Monster was introduced as “a song about dragons and witches and shit”.

Poster By Carlo Vivary

Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs. Gila Monster was introduced as a track off a new album, after which Stu shouted out drop D tuning. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Ice V contained quotes of "Ain’t It Funky Now" and “The Boss” (James Brown). The intro to Gamma Knife contained People-Vultures and Robot Stop teases. Amby quoted “So Long, Farewell” (The Sound of Music) after Iron Lung. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Wah Wah contained The River teases. Ambergris was introduced as a song about whale vomit. Hypertension contained Iron Lung quotes. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases and Ice V teases. Before Shanghai, which was introduced as a song about how the band almost broke up over a hot pot, but it was alright because they all turned into butterflies afterward, Stu asked the crowd if they had even seen the band at various Sydney venues (Goodgod, World Bar), then Ambrose sung some of Lunch Meat. Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly jam. The Grim Reaper featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress. Hell and Predator X were on the written setlist but were not played. Poster By Rowena Lloyd

The Dripping Tap was dedicated to Cavs’ father, Bill, “the best plumber in the world.” Satan Speeds Up was played for the first time known since November 15, 2014 (539 show gap), and contained a “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Shanghai featured the “let’s get real high” jam from Grow Wings and Fly. This Thing contained “Incredible” (M Beat) quotes. Most of What I Like was played fully electric for the first time. Previous performances were done acoustically and partially acoustic. See Most of What I Like. The Wheel and Evil Death Roll were switched on the physical setlist, but were swapped because "Amby wants to keep chilling". Evil Death Roll contained Iron Lung quotes. Following the show those attending both the early and late shows were allowed to stay in the venue and the band's new album PetroDragonic Apocalypse was played over the PA. KGLW.net Staff Notes: While it was widely believed that Satan Speeds Up had never been played live prior to this show; per Stu's comments a previously unnoted performance took place at the 2014 St. Kilda Festival (February 9, 2014). As there are no known recordings of the band's set at the 2014 St. Kilda Festival, if anyone has any information on what was played at the 2014 St. Kilda Festival show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea 2000 Standard / 500 Foil

Band sound tech Gaspard De Meulemeester was brought onstage to do the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion, which he did in French.  Honey contained Sleep Drifter teases. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. The Dripping Tap contained Crumbling Castle teases and quotes, Cellophane teases and quotes, Sea of Trees teases and Head On/Pill teases.

Poster By Jason Galea
420 Standard / 120 Foil

This was a three-hour marathon show and the first marathon show to be performed as a single set. The show opened with a video of Amby's father, Broderick Smith, introducing the band. Eyes Like the Sky through Evil Man was dedicated to Broderick Smith and featured Broderick’s narration from the Eyes Like the Sky album played over the PA while the band played, and photos of Broderick displayed on the large screen behind the band. Eyes Like the Sky, Year Of Our Lord, and The Raid were played for the first time since December 1, 2018 (192 show gap). Evil Man was played for the first time since February 18, 2016 (449 show gap). Prior to Gaia, Joey quoted “I Love L.A.” (Randy Newman). The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. During the drum solo by Cavs following Astroturf the rest of the band left the stage, then returned and performed a metal vamp over the end of the solo. Shanghai featured the Grow Wings and Fly “let’s get real high” jam. Ambergris featured an extended intro during which Joey and Amby contemplated the nature of sexiness. The Dripping Tap was dedicated by Amby to Cavs’ dad and to his “first music teacher who said my voice sounds weird,” and contained Cellophane teases and Hot Water teases.

Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained alternate lyrics and a Dragon jam. Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer contained an Ice V jam with lyrics. The River contained Ice V teases. Sleep Drifter contained Rattlesnake teases, Am I In Heaven? teases, and Billabong Valley quotes/teases. The vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion was done by an audience member named Lars who was brought on stage. Cavs teased Metallica’s One when Lars introduced himself. Straws In The Wind was humorously dedicated to everyone under 3 years old, as Joey had spotted multiple babies in the crowd and contained Extinction quotes.  Gaia contained a drum solo by Cavs.

Evil Death Roll contained Converge teases and "Animals in Australia" quotes.  Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly jam.  The vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion was performed by audience member, Axel, who was brought on stage.  Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam with lyrics.

Poster By Max Löffler

The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber and "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. Evil Death Roll contained Converge teases. Rattlesnake contained Boogieman Sam quotes and Flamethrower teases. K.G.L.W. (Outro) was on the printed setlist after Rattlesnake but was not played. Poster by Drew Millward
The band headlined the festival’s Alternative Stage. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Dragon teases and quotes. Hell was introduced as a song about planet earth.

Before Gaia, Joey teases Break Stuff (Limp Bizkit). Hypertension contained an Ice V intro, a Hot Water quote and a Work This Time Tease. Sea of Trees contained Hypertension, Robot Stop, and Hot Water teases. Robot Stop contained Hot Water and The Dripping Tap teases. Hot Water had its lyrics changed to “São Paulo”.

This show featured the debut of Flamethrower. Joey commented after, that they would do the last half of the song next time. Am I In Heaven? contained Sad Pilot, Flamethrower, and Cut Throat Boogie teases, a Witchcraft tease, and Iron Lung teases and quotes. Following Flamethrower, Joey shouted out opener Grace Cummings. This Thing contained La Grange (ZZ Top) teases and lyrics parodying the song. Iron Lung contained a Hypertension tease. Hypertension contained Witchcraft, Magma, and Ice V teases. Work This Time contained Ice V teases from Cavs. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. The written setlist had Doom City and Minimum Brain Size before Float Along - Fill Your Lungs but they were cut for time. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

This show featured the debut of Daily Blues. Grace Cummings unfortunately missed a third show due to illness, and was replaced with Naarm synth-punk band Dr Sure's Unusual Practice. Crumbling Castle contained a Witchcraft tease. The Fourth Colour contained a Daily Blues jam with lyrics. Rattlesnake contained an intro jam while Ambrose ran offstage. The jam contained Sleep Drifter, Honey, and Straws In The Wind teases and the song itself contained teases of Honey, “Whole Lotta Rosie” (AC/DC) and Sleep Drifter. Wah Wah contained a The River intro. Only Part I, II, and III of The River were performed and they contained a Sad Pilot tease and Wah Wah teases and quotes. The Bitter Boogie was played with the drum pattern from Muddy Water. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 150
The Dripping Tap contained a Motor Spirit tease, a You Can Be Your Silhouette tease, and a Daily Blues jam.  Robot Stop started with a small Hot Water jam and contained additional Hot Water teases.

This show featured the debut of Antarctica. The Dripping Tap contained Chang'e teases, You Can Be Your Silhouette teases, Antarctica teases & quotes, and Am I In Heaven? teases. Evil Death Roll was introduced as a song about Bob Dylan and contained Witchcraft and Robot Stop teases. Ice V contained a Witchcraft tease and a "Blindness" (The Fall) jam. The Fourth Colour, which was incomplete, contained a Daily Blues jam with lyrics and "Whole Lotta Rosie" (AC/DC) teases. Supercell was introduced as a song about orange juice. Following Motor Spirit, Joey introduced the band members. Gaia contained a jam with Joey on bass, which contained a Motor Spirit tease and a drum solo.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition of 650
Holographic Edition of 200

Before Theia, Ambrose quoted Fried. The song itself contained Motor Spirit quotes, a The River jam with Wah Wah quotes, and Motor Spirit and The Silver Cord jams with lyrics. Joey did Michael Jackson-style vocal improv in the intro to Ambergris, which was introduced as a song about sperm whales and contained a short drum solo. Joey did an impression of Guy Fieri before Rats In The Sky. Cavs teased Rock and Roll (Led Zeppelin) before Sad Pilot. After Rats in the Sky, the band heckled Jason Galea to join on tambourine. Before Flight b741, the band got Cavs to hit the gong on his kit. After Flight b741, the band explained that Geelong, aka G-troit, is the sister city to Detroit, as both had a Ford production factory, which closed and destroyed the town. Joey teased Purple Haze (Jimi Hendrix) and Cavs teased Rock and Roll again. You Can Be Your Silhouette contained an extended intro where the band talked about how their talkback mics work and jazz notes. During the song itself, which contained a The End (The Doors) quote, it was described as a song about being yourself. During the intro to Straws In The Wind, the band joked about Ambrose swimming over to Canada and Ambrose walked up to the lights and sound booth.  Nuclear Fusion featured Vincent, a kid from the audience on the intro. Following the intro, Joey teased Twist (Korn). After Nuclear Fusion, Stu shouted out the stream crew. Honey contained O.N.E teases. Minimum Brain Size was introduced as a song about "loser hypermasculine people."  Prior to Rattlesnake Joey conducted a Q&A session with crowd members and Sam. Prior to Billabong Valley, Cavs ran offstage. During Billabong Valley, Joey said he can do a Limp Bizkit beat cause he doesn’t have an electric guitar and doesn’t want to take it to the [Dave] Matthews Bridge, followed by Ambrose climbing on top of the equipment truck on the side of the venue, leading to the line “I’m on the truck!” Her and I (Slow Jam 2), which was last played 2023-06-18 (50 show gap), contained a Slow Jam 1 intro as well as Iron Lung teases.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 600
Foil Edition- 200

Robot Stop featured Ambrose on saxophone and contained Sad Pilot, Converge, and Witchcraft teases. Gamma Knife contained a Motor Spirit tease. People-Vultures contained Iron Lung teases & quotes. Mr. Beat contained Sad Pilot teases. Sad Pilot was introduced as a song about donkeys and dedicated to band soundman Joe Santarpia.  Rats in the Sky was introduced as a song about chickens in the sky. Cut Throat Boogie contained The Bitter Boogie teases and was dedicated to Magic Sam. You Can Be Your Silhouette was dedicated to Alex Brettin of Mild High Club, who then briefly appeared on stage. The Fourth Colour contained quotes of Gila Monster and Mars For the Rich. Straws In the Wind contained a Rattlesnake quote. Welcome to An Altered Future was played for the first time since 2018-03-16. (304 show gap) This was also the first time the suite was performed in full. Set featured Joey on guitar and Ambrose on saxophone. Head On/Pill was not on the written setlist and featured Ambrose on saxophone and contained Am I In Heaven? and Robot Stop teases, Chang'e teases and quotes, and a Hot Water jam with lyrics. At the end of the show, Ambrose thanked Chicago for The Blues Brothers and blues music.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 1200
Foil Edition - 300
data.venuename: Huntington Bank Pavilion at Northerly Island

data.shownotes: This show took place during an unrelenting rain storm. The Dripping Tap concluded with the Streets of Cairo tease from I'm Not In Your Mind. Following Tap the band left the stage for approximately 22 minutes due to the dangers posed by wet equipment, which was repositioned to be out of the rain during the break. Boogieman Sam contained The Bitter Boogie teases. Amby quoted Singin' In the Rain (Arthur Freed/Nacio Herb Brown) in Daily Blues. Prior to Le Risque Joey shouted out Portugal. The Man. Following The Fourth Colour, Amby quoted Can't Keep My Eyes Off Of You (Frankie Valli) with lyrics changed to "I love you Portland" and John Gourley (of Portugal. The Man) came on stage and gave the band shots. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo with a Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) tease. Supercell was introduced as a song about storms. The Lord of Lightning contained an extended outro with a Cellophane tease. The Balrog was last played 2023-03-20. (85 show gap) Poster By Jason Galea Standard: 600 Rainbow Foil: 200

data.jamchart_notes: New intro; extended jam prior to final verse
data.shownotes: Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. This Thing contained an Incredible (M Beat) quote. Crumbling Castle contained a Loyalty tease. The Fourth Colour contained teases of Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) and Forty Six and 2 (Tool).  Nuclear Fusion's intro was sung by an audience member named Rob. Prior to Intrasport, Ambrose and Stu gave Lucas a shoutout for playing guitar on the track and Ambrose introduced a gong solo from Cavs. Set contained an Ice V tease. Ambrose introduced Antarctica as a song Cook wrote about his love of air conditioning. Joey tried to imitate Jacob Collier by instructing the audience to do throat singing before Black Tooth. Iron Lung contained People-Vultures teases.  Le Risque was introduced as a song about a little grey mouse and contained a Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) tease. Boogieman Sam was preceded by teases of Riff Raff (AC/DC), Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) and Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC), and contained a Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) jam with Field of Vision quotes and Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases. This led to a People-Vultures jam with Muddy Water teases and Iron Lung and Phantom Island quotes.  Mirage City was on the written setlist after Antarctica but was not played.

Her and I contained Ice V and Slow Jam 1 teases and Iron Lung teases and quotes. Before Crumbling Castle, Ambrose thanked the crowd and thanked the city for OutKast. Hog Calling Contest and Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) were teased before Flight b741. Iron Lung contained a Lava intro. Between Sad Pilot and Rats in the Sky, Ambrose shouted out the previous venues the band played in Atlanta, and made an Austin Powers reference. The Garden Goblin was dedicated to cameraman Allen and his partner who requested the song.  Following Gilgamesh Amby quoted Time After Time (Cyndi Lauper).  Set was on the written setlist as the final song but was not played.

This show featured the debuts of Jailbreak (AC/DC) and the synth outro of Flamethrower. Ambrose sung along to the walkout music, which was Party All the Time (Eddie Murphy). Antarctica contained Hot Water and Forty Six and 2 (Tool) teases. Before Hypertension, the band talked about Stu's new guitar, mentioning Jimi Hendrix and Dimebag Darrell, and joking that they wanted to play Little Wing on the table, but Cavs said no because he wanted to play Foxy Lady and Cookie wanted to play She's So Fine. Boogieman Sam was teased before Ice V, which contained Blindness (The Fall) teases. Ambrose quoted “Good day, good evening, and good night!” from The Truman Show before Rats In The Sky. Jailbreak was impromptu/not on the written setlist, unfinished, and contained a Rats In the Sky outro. The Fourth Colour was on the printed setlist after Crumbling Castle but was not played.
data.soundcheck: Motor Spirit, Crumbling Castle > The Fourth Colour

data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Superposition. The Fourth Colour contained a Dripping Tap jam with lyrics. Band manager Michelle's son Laurence joined the band on stage for Straws in the Wind, which contained Phantom Island quotes and Ambrose chanting "free free Palestine". The audience continued the Palestine chants after the song, with the band repeating the slogan once along with them and then again during Minimum Brain Size. Before Nuclear Fusion, Joey thanked King Stingray and DJ Crenshaw. A fan named Tom provided the vocal intro on Nuclear Fusion wearing a Bullant shirt. The rock version of Theia was performed, which contained a Land Before Timeland jam and Iron Lung teases & quotes. Before Ice V, which was dedicated to "the incredible country called Greece", Joey told the story of his appearance in the Ice V music video, which was filmed on the island of Idra. The song itself contained Ain't It Funky Now (James Brown) teases. Digital Black was preceded by a tease of A New World. Float Along – Fill Your Lungs contained a Motor Spirit jam with lyrics, a Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg tease, Theia teases and quotes, and a Muddy Water and Superposition tease. Welcome to an Altered Future was on the printed setlist before Digital Black but was not played.

data.footnote: first time with outro; with The Chamber Orchestra of Philadelphia
data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Phantom Island, Deadstick, Lonely Cosmos, Eternal Return, Panpsych, Spacesick, Aerodynamic, Sea of Doubt, and Silent Spirit and was played with The Chamber Orchestra of Philadelphia conducted by Sarah Hicks. During Grow Wings and Fly, which contained Am I In Heaven? teases, Stu thanked the venue, The Chamber Orchestra of Philadelphia, and Sarah Hicks. The Dripping Tap contained Am I In Heaven? teases and was performed without The Chamber Orchestra of Philadelphia. Only parts I, II, and IV of The River were played. Crumbling Castle was played with the outro (without vocals) for the first time. The Dripping Tap was not on the printed setlist, but it and the jam following Grow Wings and Fly functioned as a setbreak for the orchestra.
data.soundcheck: The River, Crumbling Castle, Dragon, Iron Lung, This Thing, Mars For The Rich

data.footnote: with outro; with The Orchestra of St. Luke’s
data.shownotes: This show was played with The Orchestra of St. Luke’s conducted by Sarah Hicks. During Grow Wings and Fly, Stu thanked The Orchestra of St. Luke’s and Sarah Hicks. Hot Water contained an Am I In Heaven? tease. Only parts I, II, and IV of The River were performed. Mars For The Rich was dedicated to the band's guitar tech Gaspard, who they then sung happy birthday to, followed by Stu asking the crowd if it was anyone else's birthday. Dragon was introduced as a song about "setting shit on fire". Following Dragon, Stu thanked The Orchestra of St. Luke’s and Sarah Hicks again and Ambrose thanked their tour manager Michelle.

data.footnote: with outro; with The Orchestra of St. Luke’s
data.shownotes: This show was played with The Orchestra of St. Luke’s conducted by Sarah Hicks. After Spacesick, Stu thanked The Orchestra of St. Luke’s and Sarah Hicks. Aerodynamic had a lyric changed to reference New York. After Sea of Doubt, Joey mentioned a wall of alumni backstage featuring acts who have previously performed at the venue, including the Beatles, Bob Dylan, Jimi Hendrix, and the Monkees, and the band expressed their desire to be added. During Grow Wings and Fly, Stu thanked The Orchestra of St. Luke’s and Sarah Hicks again. Magma, which didn't include the "rumble" section, contained Am I In Heaven?, The Dripping Tap, and Crumbling Castle teases and ended with a The River outro which contained Sad Pilot, Crumbling Castle, and Evil Death Roll teases. Only parts I, II, and IV of The River were performed. This Thing was introduced by Joey as a song about a personal secret, and included an Incredible (M-Beat) quote. Mars for the Rich was introduced as a song about Elon Musk, and included a lyric change to "you ain't coming here, the Tesla's too dear". After Mars for the Rich, the band noted that the two shows at this venue are the only two on this tour being livestreamed, wished someone a happy birthday, and exclaimed, "free Palestine motherfuckers!" After Iron Lung, the band thanked The Orchestra of St. Luke’s and Sarah Hicks one last time, as well as thanking the audience.

data.footnote: with outro; with The National Symphony Orchestra
data.shownotes: This show was played with The National Symphony Orchestra conducted by Sarah Hicks. During Grow Wings and Fly, Joey spoke about how even though Phantom Island talks about the band missing their families, the fans make it worth it. Following that, he said Free Palestine. Cut Throat Boogie featured a guitar/harmonica duel between Joey and Ambrose and was unfinished. Boogieman Sam contained Sad Pilot and Cut Throat Boogie teases. Only parts I, II, and IV of The River were performed. Before Dragon, the band mentioned Animal Collective's album Merriweather Post Pavilion, which was named after the venue.

data.footnote: with outro; with The Chicago Philharmonic
data.shownotes: This show was played with The Chicago Philharmonic conducted by Sarah Hicks. Panpsych's lyrics were changed to "Panpsych, fuck yeah". Silent Spirit contained a false start. Grow Wings and Fly contained additional lyrics about the band pissing themselves and a Theia jam with an Am I In Heaven? tease. Theia was performed in it's rock arrangement and contained Vomit Coffin and The Land Before Timeland teases, a Field of Vision jam, Sharp Dressed Man (ZZ Top) teases and quotes, and band introductions. Only parts I, II, and IV of The River were played. Following Crumbling Castle, Joey asked how the lawn was doing and said he couldn't see them (due to the venue layout making it hard to see the stage from the lawn). Stu then said he’d be in the lawn if he was watching. Mars For The Rich had lyrics changed to "Fuck Elon Musk" and "Tesla's too dear". Before Iron Lung, Ambrose thanked Chicago for hot dogs and the Blues Brothers, and Stu and Joey said Free Palestine.

data.footnote: with outro; with Colorado Symphony
data.shownotes: This show was played with The Colorado Symphony conducted by Sarah Hicks. Self-Immolate had Perihelion teases. Before The River Joey pointed out the full moon and mentioned Ozzy Osbourne. The band talked about Field of Vision and its Acid Yoga before Iron Lung.

data.footnote: with outro; with The Hollywood Bowl Orchestra
data.shownotes: This show was performed with The Hollywood Bowl Orchestra, conducted by Sarah Hicks. Grow Wings and Fly contained Plastic Boogie teases and a Hypertension jam with The Dripping Tap and Magma teases. At the start of the jam, Joey asked the pit what they were eating for dinner and said he hoped it wasn’t fish. Stu then joked that everyone had food poisoning before saying that it actually looked good. The band followed up by asking if the crowd had any desserts to share. A fan gave Cook tiramisu after he asked for it. He ate a bite and gave it back, and Stu joked that he put death cap mushrooms in it. Ambrose took a bucket of popcorn and ate it, later cleaning it off the stage after it went everywhere. This Thing was introduced by Joey as a song about Los Angeles, followed by him quoting I Love L.A. (Randy Newman). Mars for the Rich was dedicated to Elon Musk, with Stu saying the band decided all billionaires are going to prison (except Cook because he was chill) and had lyrics changed to “Tesla’s too dear” alongside an added “Free Palestine”. Ambrose gave a shout-out to his mom before Iron Lung. During the song, he walked into the garden pit and dumped a bucket of popcorn on himself.

data.footnote: with outro; with the San Diego Symphony Orchestra
data.shownotes: This show was played with The San Diego Symphony Orchestra conducted by Sarah Hicks. Sea of Doubt was introduced as "another one about the ocean." Grow Wings and Fly contained Motor Spirit, Wah Wah and Witchcraft teases. Before The River Stu received a tie-dye suit jacket from the audience. Mars For the Rich had lyric changed to "the Tesla's too dear" and was dedicated to David Bowie. Iron Lung contained Am I In Heaven? teases.
data.venuename: The Rady Shell at Jacobs Park

data.footnote: with outro; with Covent Garden Sinfonia
data.shownotes: This show was played with Covent Garden Sinfonia conducted by Chad Kelly. Before Phantom Island, the band said it was the best day of their lives and shouted out the orchestra and conductor Chad Kelly. After Eternal Return, Joey asked if anyone in the crowd was at the previous Brixton shows. Aerodynamic featured a lyric change to "watch the whole world go by". The Grow Wings and Fly jam had Hot Water, Head On/Pill and The Great Chain of Being teases. This Thing featured an Incredible (M Beat) quote. Mars For the Rich was introduced by Joey as a song about "how much of a massive fucking cunt" Elon Musk is and had a lyric change to "fuck Elon Musk!" Joey said "Free Palestine" after Dragon and Iron Lung.
data.soundcheck: Lonely Cosmos, The River, Crumbling Castle

data.footnote: with outro, with The Orchestre Lamoureux
data.shownotes: This show was played with The Orchestre Lamoureux conducted by Chad Kelly. After Eternal Return, Chad Kelly took a bathroom break, leading the band to do an impromptu jam. The Grow Wings and Fly jam had a Rattlesnake tease. This Thing was introduced as a song about Busy P.

data.footnote: with outro; with Sinfonia Rotterdam
data.shownotes: This show was played with Sinfonia Rotterdam conducted by Chad Kelly. Panpsych's lyrics were changed to "Panpsych, fuck yeah." Aerodynamic's lyrics were changed to "sit here and watch Max Verstappen float by." Following Silent Spirit, Joey dedicted Grow Wings and Fly to his daughter. Following Grow Wings and Fly, Joey shouted out conductor Chad Kelly and Amby shouted out Sinfonia Amsterdam (which Stu then corrected to Rotterdam).  the intermission jam contained an extensive The Land Before Timeland jam. Evil Death Roll contained a Robot Stop tease. The River contained Thunderstruck (AC/DC) teases. Following Crumbling Castle, which contained a The River tease, Joey shouted out Cavs. Mars For The Rich had lyrics changed to "Fuck Donald Trump" and "Tesla's too dear".

data.footnote: with outro; with The Baltic Philharmonic Symphony Orchestra
data.shownotes: This show was played with The Baltic Philharmonic Symphony Orchestra conducted by Chad Kelly. The intermission jam featured Witchcraft teases and Motor Spirit quotes. The River also contained Motor Spirit quotes.

data.footnote: with outro; with Sydney Symphony Orchestra
data.shownotes: This show was played with The Sydney Symphony Orchestra conducted by Chad Kelly.  Intermission Jam contained Hypertension teases.  The River contained teases of Thunderstruck (AC/DC) and Her and I.  Dragon was introduced as a song about capitalism.  Before Iron Lung Joey said Free Palestine.

data.footnote: with outro; with Sydney Symphony Orchestra
data.shownotes: This show was played with The Sydney Symphony Orchestra conducted by Chad Kelly. Before the band went on stage, they were introduced by Uncle Michael West during a freewheeling acknowledgement of country, fauna, and waterways. After Spacesick, Stu shouted out the orchestra and said how lucky they felt to play there, and Joey pointed out the audience could have gone to see Franz Ferdinand instead, who were performing that evening on the steps immediately outside the Sydney Opera House, but chose them; Aerodynamic then contained a lyric change to "just gonna sit here and watch Franz Ferdinand roll by". After Sea of Doubt, the band thanked Chad. Stu shouted out both the orchestra and Chad again at the end of Grow Wings and Fly. As the intermission jam started, Joey instructed the band to play more atonally as he related the story of playing the same venue when opening for The Drones on 2013-04-27, being unable to find a bathroom and choosing to urinate on that very stage. Daily Blues contained Green River teases. Jackson, one-half of the usual stream team and its only present member at this show, was shouted out after Daily Blues. Happy Birthday was performed by the orchestra for Lucas; afterwards Stu described him as one of his oldest friends and said he brought the band together. Crumbling Castle contained a lyric change to "thank you Gaspard", in reference to the band's guitar tech. Stu shouted out the orchestra and Chad after Crumbling Castle. Joey told another urination story before This Thing, which was then introduced as a song about that story. This Thing contained a lyric change to "and that is what makes this hard quiz" in reference to the Australian game show Hard Quiz, where the band was recently selected as a speciality topic by a fan Finn; who the band also joked about spotting in a small mosh pit that had formed at the end of an aisle on the venue floor. Before Mars for the Rich, Stu said "fuck Jeff Bezos" and repeatedly called for all billionaires to be sent to jail. The song itself contained a lyric change to "the Tesla's too dear". At the end, Ambrose said "thank you Sexy Alien". Dragon was dedicated to people who know about drop B and described as a song by Limp Bizkit; before the song started, Blind (Korn) was teased. At the end of the show, Chad and the orchestra were thanked again, along with Sam, Terrence and Jason.

data.footnote: with outro, The Queensland Symphony Orchestra
data.shownotes: This show was played with The Queensland Symphony Orchestra conducted by Chad Kelly.  Intermission Jam contained The Land Before Timeland teases.  Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap teases.

data.footnote: With outro, with The Queensland Symphony Orchestra
data.shownotes: This show was played with The Queensland Symphony Orchestra conducted by Chad Kelly. The Intermission Jam contained Panpsych teases. Ice V contained Blindness (The Fall), Ain't It Funky Now (James Brown), The Land Before Timeland, Head On/Pill and Am I In Heaven? teases.

data.footnote: with Orchestra Victoria
data.shownotes: This show was played with Orchestra Victoria conducted by Chad Kelly. The Intermission Jam contained Daily Blues teases. Robot Stop contained The Dripping Tap and Hot Water teases.
